bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: play had to Judge Cushman-mother under advisemnt
IN THE UNITED STATE SISTRICT, WESERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF MRS. GLADYS FREDRIKA FUSON, FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.} NO.3451 PETITION IN FORMA PAUPERIS

YOur prtitioner herin respecfully shows to the Court that she is a poor person, a native born citizen of the United States; that she is imprisoned in the Seattle, King County, Washington, having been arrested on a verbal order of the respondent by Seattle Police woman at the City of Port Townsend, October 20, 1916; that she has been advised by Counsel, and belices that her imprisonemnt is in violation of the guarantees of the Costitution of the United STates; that she had no property watever, except an allowance of $12.50 semi-mothly ordered by JudgeByd Tallman of the Superior Court of King County in her husbands section for divorce; that she has no friends financially able to assist her; that her atterorney herein, also knows her finacial condition and that in view therof told her and her friends, that regardless of the event of this action, that he would not accept from her or from her friends any compensation for his services in this proceeding.
Petitioner further states, that the deposits heretofore made herein were made from allowances of alimony pendent lite aboce refered to.
WHEREFORE your petitioner prays that she be permitted to sprosecute this section as a poor person, under the law and practice of this Court.
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING} SS
GLADYS FREDRIKA FUSON being first duly sworn on oath says: that she has heard the foregoing petition read and belices the statement therin contained.
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN to before me this 30th day of October AD 1916.
W.K. SICKELS County Clerk Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, reising at Seatltle . Earl G. Comer Depuyty Clerk
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF MRS. GLADYS FREDRIKA FUSON, FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
FILED IN THE U.S. Distict Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION OCT 26 1916 FRANK L CROSBY CLERK Edin Laxew Deputy
